job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Palestine, TX
pros: Most employees are knowledgeable and care about the community.
cons: Raises are given sporadically. No annul raises. Annul evaluations are performed but no incentive to do better.

review_title: The people make it worth it
pros: Good support from administration. Lots of room to grow your strengths and interests
cons: Rural hospital with minimal resources due to the area (not the hospital itself)

review_title: Good Place to work.  Compensation is competitive.
pros: Overall leadership is good, compensation is competitive for the area, most coworkers are easy to work with and the job is generally rewarding.
cons: Lack of communication, very strong corporate overhead, and as a for-profit hospital many areas of the hospital and services provided are extremely dated. Job is extremely stressful and recognition for hardworking support employees is non-existent.

pros: You get all the overtime you want even bonuses for pick up shifts. You get the times you ask off most of the time.
cons: It pays very little $8.50 starting for Pcts you take a full load of patient which is 8-16 to bath,feed and change for 12 hours, always understaffed, you work every other holiday. And they offer blue cross but it cost near a hundred a check and you get paid every two weeks you overall make $1,200 monthly.

pros: The people I work with are amazing, there is a lot of team work.
cons: They have not given a raise  in over 5 years, they always  make it seem like you will be receiving a raise but that never happens because Life point never approves any!  Very frustrating!

job_title: Critical Care Technician/I C U in Palestine, TX
pros: Awesome nursing staff! One of the best places I had the opportunity to work. The nurses in the I.C.U were some of the most talented ladies and everyone was so caring and compassionate
cons: Starting pay was liw, but upon proving myself I was given a very healthy raise

review_title: It was mostly good. Paid above minimum wage and had a good work environment with coworkers
cons: Asking you to work days you should have permanently off
